com.pcloud.sdk

Class DataSink

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pcloud.sdk.DataSink

  • public abstract class DataSink
extends java.lang.Object
    A consumer of data.

    An abstraction over the byte stream reading operations, this class allows for a flexible way to read bytes from a BufferedSource.

    • The create(File) method can be used for writing data to a file.
    • For any other cases just extend the class and do your magic in the readAll(BufferedSource) method.

    • Method Detail

      • readAll

        public abstract void readAll(okio.BufferedSource source)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes from a source

        Do any reading here.

        There is no explicit need to call Closeable.close() on the source argument, it will be closed for you.

        Parameters:
        source - the source
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the io exception

      • create

        public static DataSink create(java.io.File file)
        Create a DataSink instance that writes data to a file.
        Parameters:
        file - a file where the data will be written. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        a DataSink that will write to the given file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - on a null file argument.
